caption.p:
Relationship between estimated body mass (kg; ±
SE ) and the linear effect of relative global temperature (°C derived from GISP2 δ 18O values) from the mixed model regression with fixed effects of temperature and the random effect of site. Regression line ( y = −40.9 kg/°C ± 10) with lines for specific regressions (intercepts for B. bison (black): 520.9 ± 36.1; B. occidentalis (dark gray): 675.6 ± 36.2; B. antiquus (light gray): 737.3 ± 44.7; p < .001, n = 849, N = 53). Regression line for the small‐sized Bison clade (red line) is −63 kg/°C (± 10; z = −6.11 p < .001) with an intercept at 648 ± 26 kg
